data.title: The last trade the Calgary Flames made with each NHL team
data.meta_description: It's time to revisit the last time the Flames have made a trade with each NHL team. Some are home runs, while others are complete misses.
data.text:
Trades! Let’s look at the last trade the Calgary Flames have made with each NHL team. The nearest trade with a team took place a little over a month ago at the 2024 NHL Draft. The furthest trade with a team was all the way back in the beginning of 2012. Check out the list, sorted by the date of trade.

Philadelphia Flyers

June 29, 2024: Flames trade a 2024 4th round draft pick in exchange for a 2024 5th round draft pick (Luke Misa) and a 2024 6th round draft pick (Eric Jamieson).

Washington Capitals

June 27, 2024: Andrew Mangiapane to the Washington Capitals in exchange for a 2025 2nd round draft pick.

New Jersey Devils

June 19, 2024: Jacob Markstrom to the New Jersey Devils in exchange for Kevin Bahl and a top-10 protected 2025 1st round draft pick.

San Jose Sharks

March 8, 2024: Flames acquire Nikita Okhotiuk from the San Jose Sharks in exchange for a 2024 5th round draft pick.

Dallas Stars

March 7, 2024: Flames (Wranglers) trade Mattias Emilio Pettersson to the Dallas Stars in exchange for Riley Damiani.

Vegas Golden Knights

March 6, 2024: Noah Hanifin to the Vegas Golden Knights in exchange for Daniil Miromanov, and unprotected 2026 1st round draft pick, and a 2024 3rd round draft pick (CGY selected Kirill Zarubin).

Vancouver Canucks

January 31, 2024: Elias Lindholm to the Vancouver Canucks in exchange for Andrei Kuzmenko, Hunter Brzustewicz, Joni Jurmo, a 2024 1st round draft pick (CGY selected Matvei Gridin) and a 2024 4th round draft pick (CGY traded down for a 5th and a 6th and selected Luke Misa and Eric Jamieson, respectively).

Ottawa Senators

March 10, 2023: Flames (Wranglers) acquire Kristian Rubins in exchange for future considerations.

Arizona Coyotes (now Utah Hockey Club)

March 3, 2023: Flames acquire Nick Ritchie and Troy Stecher from the Arizona Coyotes in exchange for Brett Ritchie and Connor Mackey.

Toronto Maple Leafs

March 3, 2023: Maple Leafs acquire Radim Zohorna from the Calgary Flames in exchange for Dryden Hunt.

Chicago Blackhawks

March 21, 2022: Flames acquire Ryan Carpenter from the Blackhawks in exchange for a 2024 5th round draft pick.

Montreal Canadiens

August 18, 2022: The Canadiens acquired Sean Monahan and a conditional 2025 1st rounder from the Flames in exchange for future considerations.

Florida Panthers

July 22, 2022: The Panthers acquire Matthew Tkachuk in exchange for MacKenzie Weegar, Jonathan Huberdeau, Cole Schwindt, and a conditional 2025 1st.

Chicago Blackhawks

March 21, 2022: Flames acquire Ryan Carpenter from the Blackhawks in exchange for a 2024 5th round draft pick.

Seattle Kraken

March 16, 2022: Flames acquire Calle Jarnkrok from the Kraken in exchange for a 2022 2nd round draft, a 2023 3rd round draft pick, and a 2024 7th round draft pick.

Boston Bruins

July 28, 2021: Flames acquire Dan Vladar from the Bruins in exchange for a 2022 3rd rounder.

Los Angeles Kings

July 24, 2021: Kings acquire a 2021 3rd round draft pick (Kirill Kirsanov) from the Flames in exchange for a 2021 3rd round draft pick (Cameron Whynot) and a 2021 6th round draft pick (Jack Beck).

New York Rangers

October 6, 2020: Rangers acquire a 2020 1st round draft pick (#19 – Braden Schneider) from the Flames in exchange for a 2020 1st round draft pick (CGY traded down again and selected Connor Zary and a 2020 3rd round draft pick (Jeremie Poirier).

Buffalo Sabres

January 2, 2020: Sabres acquire Michael Frolik from the Flames in exchange for a 2020 4th rounder (CGY selected Daniil Chechelev).

Edmonton Oilers

July 19, 2019: Flames acquire Milan Lucic and a 2021 3rd round draft pick (CGY traded down with the Kings for a 3rd (Cameron Whynot) and a 6th (Jack Beck) from the Oilers in exchange for James Neal.

Carolina Hurricanes

June 23, 2018: Flames acquire Elias Lindholm and Noah Hanifin from the Hurricanes in exchange for Dougie Hamilton, Michael Ferland, and Adam Fox.

Detroit Red Wings

July 1, 2017: Red Wings acquire Tom McCollum from the Flames in exchange for a conditional 2018 7th rounder (conditions weren’t met, CGY received nothing).

New York Islanders

June 24, 2017: Flames acquire Travis Hamonic and a 2019 4th round draft pick (Lucas Feuk) in exchange for a 2018 1st round draft pick (Noah Dobson), a 2018 2nd round draft pick, and a 2019 2nd round draft pick.

St. Louis Blues

June 24, 2016: Flames acquire Brian Elliott from the Blues in exchange for a 2016 2nd round draft pick (this ended up becoming Jordan Kyrou).

Minnesota Wild

February 29, 2016: Flames acquire Niklas Backstrom and a 2016 6th round draft pick (Matthew Phillips) from the Wild in exchange for David Jones.

Tampa Bay Lightning

November 12, 2015: Flames acquire Kevin Poulin from the Lightning in exchange for future considerations.

Colorado Avalanche

October 4, 2015: Flames acquire Freddie Hamilton from the Avalanche in exchange for conditional 2016 7th round draft pick (conditions not met, CGY didn’t give up this pick).

Nashville Predators

July 1, 2015: Predators acquire Max Reinhart from the Flames in exchange for a conditional 2016 4th round draft pick (conditions weren’t met, CGY received nothing).

Pittsburgh Penguins

March 5, 2014: Penguins acquire Lee Stempniak from the Flames in exchange for a 2014 3rd round draft pick.

Anaheim Ducks

November 21, 2013: Ducks acquire Tim Jackman from the Flames in exchange for a 2014 6th rounder pick draft.

Columbus Blue Jackets

April 3, 2013: Blue Jackets acquire Blake Comeau from the Flames in exchange for a 2013 5th round draft pick.

Winnipeg Jets

January 30, 2012: Flames acquire Akim Aliu from the Jets in exchange for John Negrin.

Trades galore

During his tenure, Brad Treliving made a trade with almost every team in the league. He didn’t complete a trade with the Anaheim Ducks, Columbus Blue Jackets, Philadelphia Flyers, Pittsburgh Penguins, or Vegas Golden Knights. Craig Conroy knocked off one of those teams in his first year as GM, sending Noah Hanifin to Vegas.

Conroy has completed trades with seven teams so far in his tenure: the Dallas Stars, New Jersey Devils, Philadelphia Flyers, San Jose Sharks, Vancouver Canucks, Vegas Golden Knights, and the Washington Capitals.
